credential_fields.label: AWS Access Key ID
credential_fields.tooltip: You can provide the raw key or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_SECRET_KEY`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Secret Access Key
credential_fields.tooltip: You can provide the raw key or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_SECRET_KEY`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Bedrock API Key
credential_fields.tooltip: You can provide the API Key for accessing the Bedrock API.

credential_fields.label: AWS Session Token
credential_fields.tooltip: Temporary credentials session token. You can provide the raw token or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_SESSION_TOKEN`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Region Name
credential_fields.tooltip: You can provide the raw key or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_SECRET_KEY`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Session Name
credential_fields.tooltip: Name for the AWS session. You can provide the raw value or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_SESSION_NAME`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Profile Name
credential_fields.tooltip: AWS profile name to use for authentication. You can provide the raw value or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_PROFILE_NAME`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Role Name
credential_fields.tooltip: AWS IAM role name to assume. You can provide the raw value or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_ROLE_NAME`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Web Identity Token
credential_fields.tooltip: Web identity token for OIDC authentication. You can provide the raw token or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_WEB_IDENTITY_TOKEN`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Bedrock Runtime Endpoint
credential_fields.tooltip: Custom Bedrock runtime endpoint URL. You can provide the raw value or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_BEDROCK_ENDPOINT`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Access Key ID
credential_fields.tooltip: You can provide the raw key or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_SECRET_KEY`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Secret Access Key
credential_fields.tooltip: You can provide the raw key or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_SECRET_KEY`).

credential_fields.label: AWS Region Name
credential_fields.tooltip: You can provide the raw key or the environment variable (e.g. `os.environ/MY_SECRET_KEY`).

credential_fields.label: API Version
credential_fields.tooltip: By default litellm will use the latest version. If you want to use a different version, you can specify it here

credential_fields.label: API Base
credential_fields.tooltip: Enter your full Target URI from Azure Foundry here. Example:  https://litellm8397336933.openai.azure.com/openai/deployments/gpt-4o/chat/completions?api-version=2024-10-21

credential_fields.label: API Base
credential_fields.tooltip: The base URL for your Dashscope server. Defaults to https://dashscope-intl.aliyuncs.com/compatible-mode/v1 if not specified.

credential_fields.label: API Key
credential_fields.tooltip: MiniMax API Key from https://platform.minimaxi.com/

credential_fields.label: API Base URL
credential_fields.tooltip: International: https://api.minimax.io/v1, China: https://api.minimaxi.com/v1

credential_fields.label: API Base
credential_fields.tooltip: The base URL for your Ollama server. Defaults to http://localhost:11434 if not specified.

credential_fields.label: API Base
credential_fields.tooltip: Common endpoints: https://api.openai.com/v1, https://eu.api.openai.com, https://us.api.openai.com

credential_fields.label: API Base
credential_fields.tooltip: Common endpoints: https://api.openai.com/v1, https://eu.api.openai.com, https://us.api.openai.com

provider_display_name: OpenAI-Compatible Text Completion Models (Together AI, etc.)

credential_fields.label: OCI User OCID
credential_fields.tooltip: The OCID of the user making the API call

credential_fields.label: OCI Key Fingerprint
credential_fields.tooltip: The fingerprint of the API signing key

credential_fields.label: OCI Tenancy OCID
credential_fields.tooltip: The OCID of your tenancy

credential_fields.label: OCI Region
credential_fields.tooltip: The OCI region identifier (e.g., us-ashburn-1, eu-frankfurt-1)

credential_fields.label: OCI Compartment OCID
credential_fields.tooltip: The OCID of the compartment containing the GenAI resources

credential_fields.label: OCI Private Key (PEM)
credential_fields.placeholder:
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
...
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
credential_fields.tooltip: The full PEM-encoded private key content for API signing. Paste the entire key including BEGIN/END markers.

credential_fields.label: SAP AI Core Service Key (JSON)
credential_fields.tooltip: Paste your SAP AI Core service key JSON. Contains clientid, clientsecret, and service URLs.

credential_fields.label: Snowflake API Key / JWT Key for Authentication
Snowflake API Endpoint
credential_fields.tooltip: Enter the full endpoint with path here. Example: https://1234567890.snowflakecomputing.com/api/v2/cortex/inference:complete

credential_fields.label: API Base (Optional)
credential_fields.tooltip: Supports custom API base for Google Private API endpoints.

credential_fields.label: Vertex Credentials
credential_fields.tooltip: Optional - Upload your GCP service account JSON file. If not provided, uses default GCP credentials (ADC).

credential_fields.label: API Base
credential_fields.tooltip: Base URL of your WatsonX instance

credential_fields.label: API Key
credential_fields.tooltip: IBM Cloud API key. Required if not using Token or Zen API Key

credential_fields.label: IAM Token
credential_fields.tooltip: Pre-generated IAM bearer token. Use instead of API Key if you manage tokens externally

credential_fields.label: Zen API Key
credential_fields.tooltip: Zen API Key for Cloud Pak for Data deployments. Use instead of API Key for on-premises

credential_fields.label: Project ID
credential_fields.tooltip: Optional: Your Watsonx.ai Project ID

credential_fields.label: Deployment Space ID
credential_fields.tooltip: Optional: Watsonx.ai Deployment Space ID
